html:
6.9.25  11:03 pm   do you ever overthink something so that you can underthink it later?

      yes i believe so

6.9.25  11:01 pm   Do you think everyone is a philosopher?

      not everyone, but, a lot of people. certainly more than the number of people who are certified philosophers. But the most important thing i have to say about this is: not everyone will necessarily identify or recognize the exact same people as philosophers at any given time

6.9.25  10:56 pm   does the body rule the mind or does the mind rule the body?

      it's certainly some kind of collaboration

6.9.25  6:02 pm   Thoughts on seatbelts on airplanes?

      you'll immediately see their importance if you've ever been through a rough cloud and the plane drops suddenly and you see exactly who hits their head on the ceiling

6.9.25  5:57 pm   judging by what you've said previously, our planet is not good.

     i have no idea where you're getting that from. that is not a fair representation of my general opinion of our planet

      or is ours the exception?

     the most notable exception is that we probably can't breathe on any of the other planets, at least any of the ones anywhere near here. but that is admittedly a very human centric perspective

6.9.25  5:31 pm   What's your favorite holiday

      new years, but i'm not referring to the evening of december 31, but rather the day of january 1st, in the daytime

6.9.25  5:21 pm   The parasocial effect I'm experiencing is intense. Do you have any suggestions to help me chill out?

      you seem already pretty chilled out

6.9.25  4:53 pm   do you have any plans to make a feature-length film down the road?

      not exactly

6.9.25  4:19 pm   who inspired you to make music?

      no person in particular. in fact it was music itself that inspired me to get involved with music

6.9.25  3:53 pm   do you prefer the abbreviation for september as 'sep' or 'sept'?

      they're both good. it just depends on how much time you have

6.9.25  3:28 pm   don't you think that places are so cool? can we get more places everywhere please

      be careful what you wish for

6.9.25  3:27 pm   Do you like arguing with people 

      no, but that doesn't mean i don't want to talk about problems we may be having with each other

6.9.25  2:21 pm   Have I gone crazy? How about you? What about someone else?

      maybe 49%

6.9.25  2:19 pm   If God created us, who created God?

      i'm not sure if anyone has got around to doing that yet

6.9.25  10:32 am   thoughts on calvin and hobbes?

      i've only read a handful of episodes. i only remember the one where calvin has figured out that the second bowl of chocolate frosted sugar bombs is always better than the first or the third, based on some kind of sugar-milk dynamics that play out

6.9.25  9:37 am   why in the name of the b8 horsey does the "grünfeld defence" feel like black magic that should be banned for the grater good of humanity & orcas alike ? 

      i've never heard of it, but based on everything you said i'm guessing it's been used, extremely well, by one of your rivals

6.9.25  9:12 am   Do you have a teeny tiny gnome in your head that writes all your songs?

      if we're going with that sort of gnome mechanics, i'd have to argue that i would be the gnome itself

6.9.25  7:12 am   Hey, starting a game development project, and I've been wondering which I should build first: a good story that I put mechanics onto, or a solid bit of gameplay that I weave a story into. I already know what I want the story and gameplay to each be about, but the different processes feel like they'll end up with wildly different results. Obviously, I'm not asking you to choose for me, but do you have any advice on how to choose a process when they're so different?

      honestly both ways are great, but you are probably right that they have different results. the only way to know is to try both ways. I'm not suggesting you try both for this project, but i am probably suggesting you try it one way for this project and the other way for another project. it doesn't matter which order you try them, and you can almost be sure that there's probably an alternate version of you in a different reality who did it in the opposite order. could even be fun to pretend that's you the first time around

6.9.25  3:16 am   Why do we walk with our legs, shouldn't we just roll around. That'd be sick

      there's a time and place for that

6.9.25  1:38 am   this "im feeling randy" guy is upsetting me quite a lot. i just got a funny one i think the question was like.. i dont remember what it was like but i know it had something to do with eggs.. maybe: how do you feel about eggs. anyway you answered: "HATCH. DAMNIT" i think and i thought that was funny but then i accidentally pressed random question again. welll i dont know if i could say accidentally. i feel like i was really going for it but just as i was right about to click i realized how funny the answer was and wanted to stay a moment longer. but its gone now and ill never see it again. actually maybe i will because ive gotten a lot of the same questions twice and sometimes thrice. but i probably wont because this time i want to see that question twice and sometimes thrice. anyway, im conking out for the night.

      ok well here's the egg thing if you want to look at it again

6.9.25  1:35 am   I'm going to dive into my laundry pile. Would you like to come with me?

      not right now

6.9.25  12:13 am   do you think you've ever made art that could be considered "avantgarde"? what do you consider to be avantgarde?

      in my view, here's where the 'avantgarde' comes into play. It's when you're bursting with creative desire but for one reason or another you feel like a hopeless amateur in whatever field you're working in. you feel technically under qualified and under-experienced, for some reason. and of course the only way to get good is to start getting some practice, but you're so concerned that the first few hundred steps you take will seem horribly lacking and underprofessional. and so you get to work, and blame the avant garde. under the guise of 'avant garde', the low-brow has a chance to immediately become high-brow. trash can go on display in a museum. heck, if you can't get into a normal museum, make an avant garde museum, which can of course be made anywhere. Maybe that sounds too easy, or trivial, but, i can assure you: the avant garde is very real, it's rock solid, and it can be a real life saver when you need it

6.8.25  11:18 pm   are you a non sequitur champion?

      no, i deal exclusively in sequiturs. they are much stronger

6.8.25  10:29 pm   have you ever considered doing a collaboration with someone else on a song?

      let's be honest, i'm a disaster to work with

6.8.25  9:48 pm   how could a 50 hour movie work?

      maybe it would be divided into episodes, and be put under a different tab. maybe something called 'series'

6.8.25  9:17 pm   Who is your arch nemesis?

      surely it's just me

6.8.25  9:14 pm   do you consider yourself a whimsical creature?

      that seems not entirely accurate and yet not entirely inaccurate

6.8.25  9:11 pm   What are your thoughts on entropy?

      as they say, "entropy is a dish best served cold"

6.8.25  9:09 pm   Was "i'm a piece of garbage" supposed to be self deprecating? And if it is, do you think self deprecating humor like that is supposed to secretly be a cry for help, which can be brushed off as a joke in case it fails?

      it was part of a writing exercise i was doing. i would randomly select a page of my journals, and then see if i could capture that in a short jingle. that particular page i selected was a particularly dismal page which had almost no creative value and clearly was full of a lot of frustration and dismay. Almost the kind of thing that would make you want to skip this page and pick another, more fruitful page. but i was not to fall for that so easily. by then i had already been well trained in one of the first ground rules of creativity, which is that garbage can be turned into fruit, quite handily in fact

6.8.25  8:21 pm   i don't know how to read or write

      i don't entirely believe you

6.8.25  6:52 pm   How do I write a question you will want to answer? (The other kind comes very naturally.)

      now i'm wondering how do i make an answer that makes you want to ask another question

6.8.25  5:28 pm   do you get a lot of sleep? some of these answer times are concerning. are you doing okay?

      those are not answer times. those are question times. Sometimes i wonder how much sleep is gotten by the people who are asking the questions, but i've begun to suspect they have devised a system where they sleep in shifts

6.8.25  4:58 pm   How much music theory should I learn before learning by doing?

      no theory will make any sense until you've been there yourself. even then, you will find out that it is still incomplete without the things you will be adding to it, perhaps throughout the course of your entire life

6.8.25  4:50 pm   How are you?

      pretty good

6.8.25  4:44 pm   How long would it take for society to collapse if all toilets disappeared? 

      that would actually strenghthen society

6.8.25  2:07 pm   Do you ever feel like the Earth could be accurately described as a "single" living thing? I was thinking about skin cells earlier and it got me wondering about components vs. wholes - I'm pretty sure the most reasonable "whole" we can talk about when it comes to life is the whole dang planet. I'd love to hear your thoughts!

      this does not sound terribly unreasonable

6.8.25  2:06 pm   Favourite road sign?

      welcome signs, welcoming you to a place

6.8.25  10:42 am   What do scientists do?

      try things, measure what happened

6.8.25  10:36 am   Do you think worms dream of a better future?

      i don't see why not

6.8.25  8:45 am   what are your thoughts on what are your thoughts on what are your thoughts questions

      simple recursion

6.8.25  7:14 am   what do you think is the best way to deal with creative block? sometimes i feel like i hit a wall and go around in circles.

      how about this: what is the name of the task you are trying to do? think about that. what do you think that's a name for? maybe see if there is some way you can re brand this

6.8.25  6:49 am   what is your favourite type of shoe?

      surprise me

6.8.25  5:31 am   What number is the most random?

      all numbers are equally random. which is in fact not random at all

6.8.25  1:35 am   which love language is the best one, objectively speaking?

      the nature of love and language is that there's no limit to the ways it can be done. some of the best ways are when you maybe didn't expect a way to be a good way and it still works, so you're like WOW! and then that way is then suddenly seen as an unexpectedly very good way

6.8.25  1:01 am   if you lived forever, do you think you would continue making art the way you do now? is there a point where you could see yourself stopping?

      i always change over time. and if i lived forever, i would change A LOT. a lot of time, means a lot of change

6.8.25  12:55 am   hi bill im excited for your next project can you please respond to this question with a fun fact

      if i tell you a fun fact then you're just going to get even more excited. this is going to get out of control

6.8.25  12:41 am   what is the motto for the checqured pants man from "Perfect"

      i see no strong reason to believe that that person has a motto. furthermore it almost seems plausible that this person does not believe that the other person has one either

6.8.25  12:01 am   Apples or oranges?

      AND. apples AND oranges

6.7.25  11:05 pm   when was the last time you used a capital letter? and why do you frequently avoid them in your videos and writing?

      i use them probably more than most people, especially in videos, where as you, in a stunning display of hypocrisy, did not use any

6.7.25  10:32 pm   how many continents are there

      that all depends on how many times you count australia
